Actually, Dan, I COULDN'T make a list of scenarios with numbers and whatnot. 
First of all, it would give away some of the secret scenarios (and let me 
tell you, I had a hell of a time figuring out ways to hide them), and 
secondly it would invalidate the Garden of Golden Apples. The whole purpose 
of the Garden was making you WORK for that information. Happy hunting.

As to what makes a good scenario... I like a good story, preferably 
extending over several levels. I also like good natural-looking terrain as 
opposed to a bunch of square rooms or a flat featureless meadow. A good 
balance between gold and enemies is always nice, as is a nice selection of 
potions strategically located on the map. A few named bosses are good, as 
long as it isn't all "Bigguyone" and "Bigguytwo". Some care should be taken 
to create realistic armies, such as having orc commanders command orcs, and 
having a few nasty mages in charge of a squad of golems and elementals. The 
most important thing, I think is to keep the levels unique and varied. I 
know I had a lot of narrow passages in TevFifty, but there were also a lot 
of open battlefields for the melee-lovers out there. And I don't know of 
anyone else who's used a floating staircase as the setting for a battle...
     -Tevildo, Prince of Cats.
